definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: No thanks. I‘d rather run Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 不，謝了，我寧願去掌管伊拉克。

sentences.english: Tommy is in charge of the rifles; traditional spears are used rarely these days.
sentences.chinese: 湯米掌管步槍，傳統的長矛現在很少使用了。

sentences.english: The business world is full of examples of hubris taking over.
sentences.chinese: 企業界到處都是自大狂掌管一切的例子。

sentences.english: And of the Levites， Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God， and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
sentences.chinese: 利未子孫中有亞希雅掌管神殿的府庫和聖物的府庫。

sentences.english: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance
sentences.chinese: 立他作王家之主，掌管他一切所有的。

sentences.english: Artemis is the Greek goddess of--anybody know?
sentences.chinese: 阿爾忒彌斯是希臘女神，掌管。。。有人知道嗎？

sentences.english: She managed the household very well.
Originally, collect in temple to administer the fragrant light of dining room.
sentences.chinese: 起初，拾得在寺內掌管食堂香燈。

sentences.english: Realize that you are in control of your own life and business.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你就可以感覺到你掌管着自己的生活和事業。

sentences.english: There are multiple security organs run by trusted Alawis.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉維派親信掌管着多個安全機構。

sentences.english: And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
sentences.chinese: 摩西的孫子，革舜的兒子細布業掌管府庫。

sentences.english: Supporting China's feudal dynasty monarch known as the highest official in charge of the state.
sentences.chinese: 我國封建王朝輔助君主掌管國事的最高官員的通稱。

sentences.english: Shubael, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the officer in charge of the treasuries.
sentences.chinese: 摩西的孫子，革舜的兒子細布業掌管府庫。

sentences.english: I would never wake up, and Tyler would take over.
sentences.chinese: 我將一睡不醒，泰勒將掌管一切。

sentences.english: The master of them was an acrid man.
sentences.chinese: 掌管他們的是個刻毒的人。

sentences.english: God rules the universe and Satan is an underling in the scheme of things.
sentences.chinese: 神掌管整個宇宙，撒但只是一個下僚。

definition: in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
to work solely on/to have as one's (or its) sole function/person or agency responsible for one specific thing
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
